#### 6.2.13
A likelihood function is given by $e^{-\frac{(\theta - 1)^2}{2}} + 3e^{-\frac{(\theta - 2)^2}{2}}$ for $\theta \in \mathbb{R}$. Numerically approximate the MLE by evaluating this function at 1000 equispaced points in (âˆ’10,10]. Also plot the likelihood function.

```{r}
likelihood <- function(theta) {
  a = exp(-((theta - 1)^2) / 2)
  b = exp(-((theta - 2)^2) / 2)
  return(a + 3 * b)
}

max = 10
min = -10
num_points = 1000

x = seq(min, max, (max - min) / num_points)
x[which.max(likelihood(x))]
```

```{r}
plot(x, likelihood(x))
```
